intro: Stiburus conrathii, commonly known as the Conrath's stiburus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Stiburus conrathii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
